title: PawtoGrader (Ongoing)
details: Participating in an exclusive Northeastern practicum course with a 6-person Agile team, extending PawtoGrader for use by 3,000+ Khoury College CS students.
Acting as client liaison with Dr. Jonathan Bell, coordinating requirements and ensuring project goals align with both faculty and platform needs.
Contributing as a full-stack developer using TypeScript, Supabase, and SurveyJS to add survey features, role-based access, and template reuse.
Developing instructor/TA dashboards for viewing survey results and analytics, and implementing automated group formation for classroom use.
Supporting Agile delivery with end-to-end testing and documentation to ensure stable releases and clear user guidance.

title: AI Powered Communication Assistant
details: Developed an AI-driven chat workflow to streamline professional profile inquiries and automate context-aware follow-ups.
Implemented real-time AI notifications delivering inquiry details (name, email, and message summaries) for rapid response and engagement.
Built with LangChain, LangGraph, and LangServe, leveraging the supervisor architecture for multi-agent coordination.
Deployed a FastAPI backend as a Docker container on AWS App Runner, ensuring scalability and stateless concurrency handling.
Hosted the React + Vite frontend on Netlify, integrated securely with the AWS backend via CORS and environment-based API routing.
Managed environment variables, secrets, and deployment pipelines through AWS ECR, enabling reproducible and portable cloud builds.

title: Portfolio Website
details: Built with React, React Router DOM, and Tailwind CSS, featuring smooth animations and transitions.
Implemented dark and light mode toggle with default theme settings.
Designed a mobile-first, responsive UI with a clean and modern layout.
Structured content via easily editable JSON configuration files for scalability and flexibility.
Hosted the website on Netlify, allowing for continuous builds and update pipeline.

title: Squegg Python API
details: Reverse-engineered the Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) protocol of the Squegg smart squeeze ball to enable desktop integration.
Developed an open-source Python API originally built for a medical research lab to stream grip strength data directly into analysis pipelines.
Implemented real-time data streaming with parsing for battery level and squeeze status via a simple command-line interface.
Packaged the project into an executable using PyInstaller for easy deployment in research environments.

title: Typographic-Latent-Space
details: Co-authored an ICLR 2023 paper, “Mapping the Typographic Latent Space of Digits as a Matter of Responsible Design.”
Implemented and trained a β-VAE to learn a latent representation of digit typography, exploring controllable generative factors via distribution sampling.
Built an automated experiment loop that iterates over a predefined configuration map, saving samples and run artifacts (configs, metadata) for reproducibility.
Produced labeled sample grids and artifacts per run to compare training settings and analyze latent space structure.

title: EcoSim: Dynamic Predator-Prey Ecosystem
details: Developed a C++ simulation modeling Predator-Prey ecosystem dynamics with advanced object-oriented programming, including inheritance and polymorphism.
Implemented sophisticated critter behaviors and basic game physics to simulate realistic movements and environmental interactions.
Deployed and optimized the simulation on the Khoury server environment, ensuring stability and performance while demonstrating development proficiency.

title: Battleship Game
details: Developed a Battleship game in Java featuring a smart algorithm opponent for player-versus-computer gameplay in manual mode.
Implemented an automated mode that enables algorithm-versus-algorithm battles for testing and competitive play.
Structured the application using JSON for data handling and the Proxy Server design pattern to ensure maintainable architecture.
Configured Gradle build automation with JaCoCo integration, achieving over 90% unit test coverage.
